page.title: 08MILK PRODUCTION - DOLPHINTON
page.content: Westmill is a family farm consisting of 170 acres:- 45 barley, 125 grass used for grazing and silage. The farm is run by father, mother and daughter. We have a dairy herd of 43 cows, Fresian and Ayrshire. We milk twice daily, average yield per cow is 5512kg milk, 4.4% butter-fat, 3.59% protein, recorded by Scottish Milk Recorder's Association. Cows are housed in cubicles, milk goes straight to bulk tank by pipeline, then uplifted by tanker daily and taken to Edinburgh Dairy. In winter feed consists of silage and barley/concentrate mix. Summer feed is grass and cake, if necessary. A.I. proven bulls are used to improve stock, milk yields and butterfat. Heifer calves are kept for replacements, bulls are reared for beef and sold at Lanark or Biggar Market.
